page.title: 12LANGTON BEEF HERD.
page.content: There are about 88 cattle in this herd,44{HEREFORD/FRIESIAN}crossed cows each with a calf.A{CHAROLAIS}and a {LIMOUSIN}bull are with the herd,so all the calves are hybrids.The Charolais' calves are bigger at birth,so the Limousin bull is used for the smaller, younger cows.All the heifer (fem.) calves are fattened and sold at 1yr. old,and the bull calves are kept until they are about 2 and sold as bullocks worth about Â£550.Local markets are at {YORK}and{MALTON. } 2yr.old "Bulling Heifers" (unmated, but ready to breed),are bought to replace stock,through a dealer at {HELLIFIELD}in the Breccon Beacons.The Charolais bull is also hired from him. Every calf is tagged with the mothers number,Ministry of Agriculture herd number,birth number and an insect repellent tag which reduces a risk of
